intro: Pavetta butaguensis, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Pavetta butaguensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
